1.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
to shudder with terror; hence, to fear; also to hasten (with anxiety)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to jump, i.e. be violently agitated; causatively, to terrify, shake off, untie
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger
a muttering (in sighing, thought, or as thunder)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

3.brief: the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

4.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to tumble, i.e. be violently agitated; specifically, to crash (of thunder); figuratively, to irritate (with anger)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to seize by the heel; figuratively, to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

5.brief: to tumble, i.e. be violently agitated; specifically, to crash (of thunder); figuratively, to irritate (with anger)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (in the sense of existence)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

7.brief: a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to close up; especially to seal

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property

8.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
{an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)}
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)

9.brief: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, a scatterer, i.e. the north wind (as dispersing clouds; only in plural)

10.brief: a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
ice (as if bald, i.e. smooth); hence, hail; by resemblance, rock crystal
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

11.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

12.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a divan (as enclosing the room); abstractly (adverbial) around
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
(only in plural) properly, steerage (as a management of ropes), i.e. (figuratively) guidance or (by implication) a plan
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

14.brief: to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth

17.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
the south; poet. the south wind

18.brief: to pound the earth (as a sign of passion); by analogy to expand (by hammering); by implication, to overlay (with thin sheets of metal)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament
strong (usu. in a bad sense, hard, bold, violent)
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard

19.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

20.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy)

gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)

rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)

to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
